La littérature française du dix-neuvième siécle bibliographie des principaux prosateurs, poètes, auteurs dramatiques et critiques : avec indication 1º pour chaque auteur, du lieu et de l'année de sa naissance et s'il y a lieu, de sa mort ; 2º pour chanque ouvrage de son format, de son éditeur, et de la date de sa première édition ; 3º á la suite de chanque auteur, des biographies et des critique litteraires parues soit sous forme de livre, suit dans les revues et journaux, tant en France qu'á l'Etranger
Tracts illustrating the history, doctrine and discipline of the Society of Friends
contenido: Sketch of the rise of the Society of Friends: their doctrines and characte (21 p.) ; Observations on the Christian doctrines and practices of the early Friends ; with some notice of the state of religion in this country in the early part of the seventeenth century (79 p.) ; Extracts from approved documents of the Religious Society of Friends , relating to the Christian doctrine (29 p.) ; A brief statement on tithes ... and a testimony to the authority of Christ in his church (16 p.) ; On the Christian doctrine of the teaching of the Holy Spirit, as held by the Society of Friends (15 p.) ; The unlawfulness of all wars and fightings under the gospel (15 p.) ; Historical sketch of the origin of the Christian discipline, or church government, of the Society of Friends (39 p.) ; On the inconsistency of tithe rent-change with the Gospel dispensation (16 p.)// Sketch of the rise of the Society of Friends: their doctrines and characte (21 p.) ; Observations on the Christian doctrines and practices of the early Friends ; with some notice of the state of religion in this country in the early part of the seventeenth century (79 p.) ; Extracts from approved documents of the Religious Society of Friends , relating to the Christian doctrine (29 p.) ; A brief statement on tithes ... and a testimony to the authority of Christ in his church (16 p.) ; On the Christian doctrine of the teaching of the Holy Spirit, as held by the Society of Friends (15 p.) ; The unlawfulness of all wars and fightings under the gospel (15 p.) ; Historical sketch of the origin of the Christian discipline, or church government, of the Society of Friends (39 p.) ; On the inconsistency of tithe rent-change with the Gospel dispensation (16 p.)//
